passage: Bengali author Toru Dutt's A Sheaf Gleaned in French Fields (1876), a volume of English translations of French poems, ______ blank scholars' understanding of the transnational and multilingual contexts in which Dutt lived and worked.
question_text: Which choice completes the text so that it conforms to the conventions of Standard English?

answer_rationales.A: Choice A is the best answer. The convention being tested is subject-verb agreement. The singular verb "has enhanced" agrees in number with the singular subject " A Sheaf Gleaned in French Fields, " which is the title of a book of poems.
answer_rationales.B: Choice B is incorrect because the plural verb "are enhancing" doesn't agree in number with the singular subject " A Sheaf Gleaned in French Fields ."
answer_rationales.C: Choice C is incorrect because the plural verb "have enhanced" doesn't agree in number with the singular subject " A Sheaf Gleaned in French Fields ."
answer_rationales.D: Choice D is incorrect because the plural verb "enhance" doesn't agree in number with the singular subject " A Sheaf Gleaned in French Fields ."
